document.docAuthor: Fricke, Ronald, Allen, Gerald R., Andréfouët, Serge, Chen, Wei-Jen, Hamel, Mélanie A., Laboute, Pierre, Mana, Ralph, Hui, Tan Heok & Uyeno, Daisuke
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of the marine and estuarine fishes of Madang District, Papua New Guinea, western Pacific Ocean, with 820 new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of the marine and estuarine fishes of Madang District, Papua New Guinea, western Pacific Ocean, with 820 new records

subSubSection.paragraph:
Amsichthys knighti (Allen, 1987 )
—Knight's dottyback

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on WAM material ( WAM P. 30356 -011). DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Central Indonesia east to Philippines and Solomon Islands , south to northern Australia . Secretive in crevices of coral reefs,
0– 10 m
. Marine.

Lubbockichthys multisquamatus (Müller & Troschel, 1849 )
—Many-scaled dottyback

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on WAM material ( WAM P. 30620 -011). DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Cocos-Keeling and Christmas islands (Indian Ocean) east to Philippines and Solomon Islands . In caves and crevices of seaward reef slopes,
12– 60 m
. Marine.

Pholidochromis marginatus (
Lubbock, 1980
)
—Margined dottyback

STATUS AT MADANG. Originally described from Madang by
Lubbock ( 1980 : 829 , fig. 4 )
. AMS , BMNH , BPBM and USNM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Northern Sulawesi ( Indonesia ); Madang and Bougainville (
Papua New Guinea
). Cryptic in crevices of coral reefs,
1– 10 m
. Marine.

Pictichromis paccagnellae (Axelrod, 1973 )
—Royal dottyback

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on specimens observed at St. PR 170 ; also photographed by A. Berberian and P. Laboute. CAS and WAM material (
CAS 63654
; WAM P. 30356 -001). DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Central Indonesia east to Solomon Islands , south to northwestern Australia . Found in coastal or seaward reefs,
5– 40 m
. Marine.

Pseudochromis alticaudex
Gill, 2004
—Spotbreast dottyback

STATUS AT MADANG. Originally described from Madang by
Gill ( 2004 : 76 , figs. 29–30 )
. AMS , USNM and WAM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Indonesia and
Papua New Guinea
to Solomon Islands . Cryptic in crevices of inshore reefs and near mangroves,
1– 8 m
. Marine.

Pseudochromis cyanotaenia Bleeker, 1857
—Surge dottyback

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Indonesia east to Kiribati ( Gilbert Islands and Vanuatu , north to Ryukyu Islands, south to New Caledonia . Cryptic in crevices of reef flats and inshore reefs,
0– 30 m
. Marine.

Pseudochromis fuscus Müller & Troschel, 1849
—Brown dottyback

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Kailola ( 1975 : 97 )
. Specimens collected at St. CTR 17 , CTR 29 . AMS , CAS , KFRS , MNHN , ROM , SMF , USNM and WAM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Sri Lanka east to Philippines and Vanuatu , north to Ryukyu and Ogasawara islands, south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . Solitary in crevices of coral or rocky reefs,
1– 30 m
. Marine.

Pseudochromis marshallensis Schultz
in Schultz, Herald, Lachner, Welander & Woods, 1953
—Orangespotted dottyback

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Indonesia east to Marshall Islands , north to Ryukyu and Ogasawara islands, south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . Solitary or in pairs in crevices of coral reefs,
0– 30 m
. Marine.

Pseudochromis tapeinosoma Bleeker, 1853
—Horesshoe-tailed dottyback
STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on a specimen collected by W.-J. Chen, St. PR 202 . NTUM and WAM material ( NTUM 10169 ; WAM P. 29624 -046).

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Indonesia east to Solomon Islands , north to southern Japan . Secretive in crevices of coral reefs,
1– 20 m
. Marine.

Pseudoplesiops immaculatus Gill & Edwards, 2002
—Immaculate dottyback STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang and New Guinea , based on AMS material ( AMS I. 17090 - 043).

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Maldives east to Indonesia and New Guinea , south to Queensland ( Australia ). Secretive in crevices of coral reefs,
2– 20 m
. Marine.

Pseudoplesiops revellei Schultz
in Schultz, Herald, Lachner, Welander & Woods, 1953
—Bearded dottyback STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang in original description by
Kailola ( 1987 b: 244 )
. WAM material. DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Caroline Islands and
Papua New Guinea
east to Pitcairn Group. Secretive in crevices of coral reefs,
3– 20 m
. Marine.

Pseudoplesiops rosae Schultz, 1943
—Large-scaled dottyback

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on AMS , CAS , USNM and WAM material ( AMS I. 17089 -046, I. 17089 -050;
CAS 67909
, 75520, 75524 ; USNM
290655 , 290656
,
290684 , 290750
; WAM P. 30626 - 006).

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Andaman Sea and Indonesia east to Marshall Islands and Samoa , north to Ryukyu Islands, south to northwestern Australia . Secretive in crevices of coral reefs,
0– 10 m
. Marine.

Pseudoplesiops typus
Bleeker, 1858
—Ring-eyed dottyback

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on specimens photographed at St. CTR 0 6 . AMS , SMF and USNM material ( AMS I. 17080 -007, I. 17089 -005, I. 17089 -007, I. 17090 -046;
SMF 34874
; USNM
290307
). DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Indonesia east to Caroline and Solomon Islands , north to Sabah ( Malaysia ), south to northwestern Australia . Secretive in coral reef crevices,
6– 20 m
. Marine.
